Line 3: Start Point [0.0375, 0.0375], End Point [0.0, 0.0375] 4. Transforming the Sketch into 3D Now, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extruding the Sketch Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.75 units towards the normal and 0.0 units in the opposite direction of normals. This will create a 3D solid model. Part 2 Instructions Creating the Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system for part 2. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and the translation vector to [0.0139, 0.0, 0.0139]. Creating the Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 1. Face 1: Draw a circle centered at [0.0049, 0.0049] with a radius of 0.0049. 2. Face 2: Draw a circle centered at [0.0049, 0.0733] with a radius of 0.0049. 3. Face 3: Draw a circle centered at [0.0049, 0.6489] with a radius of 0.0049. 4. Face 4: Draw a circle centered at [0.0049, 0.7174] with a radius of 0.0049. Extruding the Sketch Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with a depth of 0.0 units towards the normal and 0.0375 units in the opposite direction of normals. This will remove some material from the model, creating a cylindrical object with a smaller diameter tube connected to the cylinders. Please note that these instructions are based solely on the provided CAD Assembly JSON and do not take into account any additional assumptions.</description>
